bill.title: An Act Relating To Technical Tax Changes
bill.description: An Act Relating To Technical Tax Changes

history.action: Placed on Calendar for Notice on 2/19/2013
Read Second Time
Rep. Ram of Burlington spoke for the committee on Ways and Means
Third Reading Ordered
Read Third time and Passed
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Finance
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Finance
New Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Finance
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Ashe
Committed to the Committee on Finance on motion of Senator Ashe
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Finance
New Business/Third Reading
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Campbell
Read second time, reported favorably with recommendation of amendment by Senator Mullin for Committee on Finance
Question on Fourth proposal of amendment divided on request of Senator White
Fourth proposal of amendment of Finance not agreed to
Question on Sixth proposal of amendment divided on request of Senator Campbell
Senator Campbell requested & granted leave to withdraw motion
Proposal of amendment by Committee on Finance, as amended, agreed to
Roll Call, requested by Senator Mullin, Passed -- Needed 15 of 29 to Pass -- Yeas = 29, Nays = 0
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Ayer; text
Point of order on ground of lack of germaneness raised by Senator Galbraith overruled
Proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call, requested by Senator Campbell, Passed -- Needed 16 of 30 to Pass -- Yeas = 28, Nays = 2
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Cummings, Doyle, and Pollina; text
Proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call, requested by Senator Galbraith, Passed -- Needed 15 of 28 to Pass -- Yeas = 16, Nays = 12
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Zuckerman; text
Point of order on ground of lack of germaneness raised by Senator Galbraith sustained as to Second proposal of amendment of Sen. Zuckerman
Senator Sears moved to order the bill to lie.
Motion disagreed to
Senator Zuckerman requested & granted leave to withdraw the First proposal of amendment
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Kitchel and MacDonald; text
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Kitchel and MacDonald agreed to
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Rodgers; text
Senator Rodgers requested & granted leave to withdraw amendment
3rd reading ordered
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Ashe motion to amend proposal of amendment; text
Proposal of amendment agreed to
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Rodgers motion to amend proposal of amendment; text
Proposal of amendment agreed to
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Rodgers motion to amend proposal of amendment; text
Proposal of amendment not agreed to
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Bray, Ayer, Collins, and Benning motion to amend proposal of amendment; text
Proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call, requested by Senator Galbraith, Passed -- Needed 15 of 28 to Pass -- Yeas = 25, Nays = 3
Read 3rd time & passed in concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Campbell
Senate Proposal of Amendment not concurred in and Committee of Conference requested upon motion of Rep. Ancel of Calais
Speaker appointed Ancel of Calais, Ram of Burlington and Wilson of Manchester as members of the Committee of Conference on the part of the House
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
House message House appointed Conference Committee members
Committee of Conference appointed: Senators Ashe, MacDonald, and Mullin
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Baruth
Committee of Conference report submitted by Senator Mullin for Committee, text
Committee of Conference report adopted
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Baruth
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Savage of Swanton
Committee of Conference report agreed to (House bill)
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 69 of 136 to Pass -- Yeas = 108, Nays = 28
Rules Suspended and Action on the bill messaged to the Senate forthwith and the bill delivered to the Governor forthwith as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton.
House message House adopted Conference Committee report
Passed the House and Senate on 5/13/2013
Signed by Governor on 6/5/13

votes.desc: Shall the Senate propose to the House to amend the bill as recommended by the Committee on Finance, as amended?

Shall the Senate propose to the House to amend the bill as moved by Senators Bray, Ayer, Collins and Benning?
Shall the report of the Committee of Conference be adopted?
